name: Theseus
headline: GPS Denied Navigation for Drones
description: We're building a Micro Visual Positioning System (VPS) that can be retrofit onto any drone that simulates a GPS. Our VPS uses cameras and an accelerometer/gyroscope as well as reference satellite imagery for positioning. The system is entirely self contained, can't be jammed and has no RF signature.

founders.name: Carl Schoeller, Founder
founders.description: Building Theseus – defense systems independent of GPS. Before that designed and built around 2000 unique parts. Some of those are in mass production on Tesla Cybertruck and some in an Apple product.

founders.name: Sacha Levy, Founder
founders.description: UAV nav in gps denied environments.

![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/679ce8faa835bf53624cc14d/679ce8faa835bf53624cc1aa_drone-map.avif)
Theseus' Micro Visual Positioning System (VPS) empowers drones to operate in environments where GPS signals are unavailable or unreliable.
Our cutting-edge technology unlocks new capabilities, allowing operators to carry out missions over sparse farmlands, deserts, or dense forests. Independent of GPS and immune to jamming, our lightweight, cost-effective technology unlocks missions once deemed impossible.
## 
B
r
e
a
k
f
r
e
e
f
r
o
m
G
P
S
l
i
m
i
t
s
### GPS-free navigation
Navigate confidently in GPS-denied environments, and easily counter EW threats.
### Consistent precision
Achieve real-time, non-compounding positional accuracy over any length flight, ensuring reliable performance for even the most critical missions.
### Plug and play with any drone
Retrofit our Micro VPS onto any group 1+ drone. Integrations with PX4 or ArduPilot platforms take less than 30 minutes. We send the same NMEA messages a standard GPS would output.
### Mission-ready for all terrains
From deserts to forests and in any season, the Micro VPS is built to perform in the most challenging terrains, all year round.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/679ce8faa835bf53624cc14d/679ce8faa835bf53624cc18a_4e5f9de48f46c2101c5e28c4f5b2c454_home-breakfree-drone.png)

[Intelligence, Surveillance, reconnaissance ](https://theseus.us/<#w-tabs-0-data-w-pane-0>)[Redundant Navigation](https://theseus.us/<#w-tabs-0-data-w-pane-1>)[gps-denied environments](https://theseus.us/<#w-tabs-0-data-w-pane-2>)
### ISR
Retrofit our Micro VPS onto any drone in under 30 minutes, enabling retrofits on edge and longer, autonomous ISR missions regardless of EW environment. 
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/679ce8faa835bf53624cc14d/679ce8faa835bf53624cc186_usecases-1.avif)
### Redundant Navigation
A backup plan for everything from small quadcopters to light manned aviation. Micro VPS can jump in at any time to provide redundancy in the case of a GPS loss.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/679ce8faa835bf53624cc14d/679ce8faa835bf53624cc1ac_Frame%201597883263.avif)
### GPS-denied Environments
In critical missions, losing GPS shouldn’t mean losing control. Navigate seamlessly even when GPS signals are jammed, blocked, or unavailable, so you can proceed without interruption.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/679ce8faa835bf53624cc14d/679ce8faa835bf53624cc1ab_Frame%201597883263-1.avif)
## 
T
e
s
t
i
m
o
n
i
a
l
s
### Lt. COL
#### USAF
In the considered opinion of [our] AltPNT experts, Theseus offers a disproportionate value to the DoD in terms of its large potential and small investment request. Specifically, AltPNT has notoriously required robust processing enclaves and has a limited operational context due to SWAP considerations on fielded platforms. In that context, Theseus has demonstrated performance that rivals other technologies, but in a low-SWAP environment and with minimal processing requirements.
### Capt.
#### USSOCOM
Having tested the Theseus’ VizNav system for a week, I am convinced that their technology presents the best solution for a current, and ever expanding, urgent operational need. Their system’s form factor and ease of integration allows for missions that are impossible otherwise.

generated_description:
Theseus, founded in 2024 and part of Y Combinator Batch S24, is tackling a significant challenge in the drone industry: **GPS-denied navigation**. Located in [location needed], this nimble team of three is developing a cutting-edge Micro Visual Positioning System (VPS) designed to enable drones to navigate effectively in environments where GPS signals can’t be relied on—think deserts, forests, and anywhere else that might interfere with traditional navigation systems.

Their VPS leverages a combination of cameras, accelerometers, gyroscopes, and reference satellite imagery to provide precise positioning. What's impressive about this system is that it’s entirely self-contained, resilient against jamming, and carries no RF signature. This means drones outfitted with the Theseus VPS can operate seamlessly, without the risk of being disrupted by Electronic Warfare threats.

The technology’s plug-and-play feature is a game changer. It can be retrofitted onto any Group 1+ drone in under 30 minutes, meaning operators can complete missions that were once deemed impossible due to GPS limitations. The Micro VPS provides consistent positional accuracy over any flight duration, making it an ideal solution for critical missions—no matter the terrain or environmental conditions.

Safety and reliability are at the forefront of Theseus's mission. They aim to revolutionize how intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance (ISR) missions are conducted in GPS-denied environments. With endorsements from military personnel like Lt. Col. USAF and Capt. USSOCOM, it's clear that the benefits of their technology are being recognized at the highest levels.

In a world increasingly reliant on GPS, Theseus stands out as a forward-thinking player ready to redefine drone navigation. If you’re interested in learning more about their technology or exploring career opportunities, check out their [website](https://theseus.us).
